title: Lighten view of Nanital City from top
review: Gives the immense view from the hills with lighten nanital city around Nani lake. shows the real beauty of the city.

title: Must for all sky gazers
review: to visit this place you have book your visit online on aries website. happening place for kids and for parents.

title: Planetarium at highest point
review: It is a central government research center and it is said to have best telescopes located at an ideal place to view stars in the night. Unfortunately  telescope was under repair. Prior permission is required to visit and it can be booked online through their website.

title: Full view of Lake!
review: This point gives you a full view of Naini Lake and it looks like a mango in shape if you observe carefully. Amazing place to be at, great point for photography too!

title: A must visit for all age group!!
review: Title: A must visit for all age group!!

title: One of the best place to visit with kids for General Knowledge
review: It has Asia largest telescope by which you can see stars in day time, wonderful place and scientific reason to promote and explore astronomy.

title: Nice!!
review: Reaching this point is a bit tricky as Maps will point you in the wring direction so you will have to take the help of locals to reach here.

title: May 18 visit
review: Takes 20 mins from Mall Road. Entry is free and we had visited in the afternoon. We were not allowed to go beyond the science centre where they show a 40 mins video on Solar system , constellations and galaxies. Irony is that visitors aren't allowed in the main office where they have the Telescope.

title: Nice view from the place...
review: Located prominently near the zoo, this place offers some great view of the entire nainital valley... Amazing place for one time visit...

title: Good place
review: This is a good place to visit in Nainital. Entry is free for here. It has the largest telescope in Asia.

title: Astro observatory
review: Fanatastic place if u have intrest in  space nd astro

title: astronomical site
review: one should visit this place and observe what we can see by naked eye through high telescopic observatory. One should visit this and Guide will tell you more about and through there programme coordinator. interesting for students and families to know our astronomy

title: Must visit if you''re in Nainitial
review: This observatory is 9 kms from Nainitial. Gives you an insight of our galaxy and stars, what was our solr system like some thousand years ago and what it would be after some thousand years. What we missed was the night viewing through telescope which is permitted for only 2 hours starting at 6.30 pm... DO VISIT.

title: Astro Info
review: The observatory is situated approx. 10-12 kms from nainitaal. The place is good if one has some interest in astronomy. There are three shows which provides information about astronomical science.  Overall value for money.

title: An astronomical experience
review: You would not like to miss an opportunity to visit this observatory.  Though you need to have a clear day and night to be able to see the planets from this observatory.

title: Amazing Human Creation
review: This enormous observatory reminded me of a modern art exposition. Beautiful sandstone shapes carved centuries ago that chart the stars.

title: amazing experience
review: you need to have a clear day and night to be able to see the planets from this observatory.A good place for adults as well as kids, as they have some wonderful telescopes.

title: Super Like!
review: Great attraction for all age groups. The views from this location are spectacular. easily accessible by road.

title: Aryabhatta Observatory
review: There was a very famous observatory known as aryabhatta observatory in nainital. It is very much famous for the large view of universe from their telescopes.

title: ARIES
review: ARIES stands for Aryabhatta Research Institute for Observational Sciences. 8 km away from Nainital on Manora Peak is the observatory which is one of India's oldest. Prior permission is needed to visit the observatory where studies in astrophysics are conducted.

title: Nightly build
review: The observatory is some 15 Km from Nainital and is very good place. You have to ask for permission and it is a very magicial place.

title: observatory
review: The observatory has one of the most advanced telescopes in india,which measures the movement of stars,planets,and other  heavenly bodies to great precision.The entry  in the observatory is by permission only and timings are fixed

title: Dont waste time
review: Don't even think of going to this place. They don't take money but you are not allowed to see anything except the telescope from outside and also its open only from 2pm - 4pm

title: Beauty on earth...
review: The observatory is some 15 Km from Nainital and is very good place. You have to ask for permission and it is a very magical place.

title: Unapproachable
review: Tried to know the timings and other details but all the efforts are in vein. Hardly a tourist would have visited this Observatory ARIES in Nainital

title: IT IS AWESOME!!!!!
review: if u get d opportunity of going there, u must grab it cuz maybe u wont get that again

title: Amazing Observatory
review: Located quite close to Nainital, the place requires special permissions for entry. Amazing telescopes present there offer superb astronomical views.

title: Aryabhatta Research Institute of Observational Sciences (ARIES)
review: It is about 4.5 km from Nainital. Situated at an altitude of (1951 MT). Observatory is basically a place of astronomical studies. Public is shown round some of the instruments during working days at afternoons. For night viewing three four days on moonlight nights are fixed and permission is needed.

title: Full of Learning!
review: Situated about 10km from Nainital, it is easily approachable. A good place for adults as well as kids, as they have some wonderful telescopes for star gazing.

title: Observe tray
review: Well just walkin to the observatory n if u ur lucky like us no one is going to stop you

title: Different Experience
review: Go to this place for and amazing experience.  Look at the stars. Very Nominal Fee and we spent  about 2 hrs here

title: Great views of the valley
review: I have been here twice, both times the actual place was shut bu the views are great. Would be great if they could sort out the open and shut timings and days - AND post this information on a board at the juncture where the road for the observatory starts and NOT 3 kms afterwords at the observatory itself and thereby save a drive to unsuspecting tourists.

title: Visit to the Astronomical Observatory
review: This observatory works under the Dept. of Science & Technology, Govt of India and is now known as ARIES (Aryabhatta Research Institute).

title: Plan green grass field near observatory
review: Don't forget to see green grass field near observatory. You will love the small village & valley. years back we been to this place and I really liked the small village near Nainital. You will find so many interesting thing in this place.
